multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I'm hearing threatening voices that aren't actually there, and I also have a headache.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I started experiencing these symptoms about twelve hours ago.
Do you have any history of psychiatric disorders, either personally or in your family?
No, I do not have any history of psychiatric disorders personally or in my family.
Have you recently experienced any significant stress, changes in sleep patterns, or started taking any new medications?
I have not experienced any significant stress, changes in sleep patterns, or started any new medications recently.
Have you sustained any head injuries recently or in the past that might be related to your symptoms?
Yes, I was found with a small cut on my forehead recently.
Were you evaluated by a medical professional for the head injury, and did you have any imaging studies like a CT scan or MRI performed?
Yes, I was evaluated by a medical professional and had a head CT scan performed, which was normal.
Have these auditory hallucinations and headache symptoms persisted continuously since they started, or have they fluctuated in intensity?
The symptoms have persisted continuously since they started.
Final Diagnosis: Substance-induced psychotic disorder.
